title: How to Make a Hot Dog Octopus

steps.headline: Cut a hot dog in half.
Turn one half on its flat side.
steps.description: From about an inch (2.54 cm) from the top, cut a slit all the way through to the bottom. This would make 2 legs.

steps.headline: Turn the hot dog 90 degrees to the uncut side and repeat.
steps.description: This would make 4 legs so far.

steps.headline: Hold 3 legs up and look "inside".
steps.description: You are going to cut the "ridge" of the 4th leg, matching the length of the cuts. One of these slits are going to make 2 legs. Repeat for the 3 other legs to make 8 legs total.

steps.headline: Boil the hot dogs.
steps.description: Be aware that the legs will curl up in the process, so be sure that there's enough room in the pot.

steps.headline: Drain them using a slotted spoon.

text: Cut a hot dog in half.  Turn one half on its flat side. From about an inch (2.54 cm) from the top, cut a slit all the way through to the bottom. This would make 2 legs. Turn the hot dog 90 degrees to the uncut side and repeat. This would make 4 legs so far. Hold 3 legs up and look "inside". You are going to cut the "ridge" of the 4th leg, matching the length of the cuts. One of these slits are going to make 2 legs. Repeat for the 3 other legs to make 8 legs total. Boil the hot dogs. Be aware that the legs will curl up in the process, so be sure that there's enough room in the pot. Drain them using a slotted spoon.  Cool and enjoy.
sentences: Cut a hot dog in half.
Turn one half on its flat side.
From about an inch (2.54 cm) from the top, cut a slit all the way through to the bottom.
Turn the hot dog 90 degrees to the uncut side and repeat.
This would make 4 legs so far.
You are going to cut the "ridge" of the 4th leg, matching the length of the cuts.
One of these slits are going to make 2 legs.
Repeat for the 3 other legs to make 8 legs total.
Be aware that the legs will curl up in the process, so be sure that there's enough room in the pot.
Drain them using a slotted spoon.
